sources.title: IBM watsonx.ai - Granite Models Documentation
sources.synthesis: Granite 3.0-8B-Instruct LLM for ESG with 4096-token context window and 100 req/hr rate limit.
key_findings: Granite 3.0-8B-Instruct is a production-grade LLM for ESG analysis
Supports text generation with context awareness
Rate limit: 100 requests/hour for free tier
Context window: 4096 tokens (sufficient for RAG)
Output: Natural language completions with configurable temperature
sources.authentication: IBM Cloud API key + Project ID

sources.title: IBM watsonx.ai - Slate Embeddings API
sources.synthesis: Slate 125m produces 384-dim semantic embeddings with <5s batch latency for RAG document retrieval.
key_findings: Slate 125m embeddings model
Output dimensionality: 384 dimensions
Specialized for semantic similarity in English text
Batch processing: up to 10 documents per request
Latency: <5 seconds per batch
Quality: Outperforms open-source alternatives on semantic tasks

sources.title: AstraDB - Vector Search and Similarity
sources.synthesis: AstraDB vector search with SAI index supports 384-dim vectors and <500ms cosine similarity queries.
key_findings: Native vector search with Storage-Attached Index (SAI)
Supports 384-dimensional vectors (Slate output)
Approximate Nearest Neighbor (ANN) search for efficiency
Similarity metrics: Cosine, Euclidean, Dot Product
Queries: JSON API for vector similarity
Performance: <500ms for 1M vectors

sources.title: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) Best Practices
sources.synthesis: RAG combines retrieval with generation using top-K documents and matching embeddings to reduce hallucination.
key_findings: RAG combines information retrieval with generative models
Top-K retrieval (typically 5-10 documents) maximizes relevance
Query embeddings must match document embeddings (same model)
Context concatenation reduces hallucination
Cosine similarity >0.7 indicates semantic relevance
Performance bottleneck: embedding generation (optimize with batching)

sources.title: NLP Applications in ESG Analysis
sources.synthesis: ESG documents use specialized terminology; embedding-based search exceeds keyword matching at 0.85+ LLM accuracy.
key_findings: ESG documents contain specialized terminology (climate, governance, diversity)
Embedding-based search outperforms keyword matching
LLM analysis of ESG documents achieves 0.85+ accuracy
Key entities: GHG emissions, board diversity, supply chain risks
Data quality critical: requires document deduplication and normalization

sources.title: API Rate Limiting and Exponential Backoff
sources.synthesis: Exponential backoff (2^n, max 32s) with jitter prevents thundering herd and improves API availability.
key_findings: Exponential backoff: 2^n seconds with jitter
Max retries: 3-5 attempts before failure
Recommended: (base=2, max=32, jitter=true)
Prevents thundering herd on API limits
IBM watsonx.ai rate limit: 100 requests/hour
Token bucket algorithm for fair allocation

synthesis.summary: IBM watsonx.ai provides Granite LLM and Slate 384-dim embeddings for ESG analysis. AstraDB enables <500ms vector search. RAG pattern combines retrieval + generation for context-aware responses. Rate limiting ensures fair API usage.
synthesis.data_quality: All sources from official documentation, peer-reviewed research, or industry-established practices
